title: As a student how can I get access of 'turnitin, com' for free to check my plagiarism? - Quora

response.answer_text: You ought to have “free” access to Turnitin checker If your school has already subscribed. Typically, your Tutor should give you a class ID so you can join his Turnitin class and submit assignments. He will choose at his end whether you get to see the plagiarism report or not. Instances where you can't see report yet need to see plagiarism score before submission, it doesn't help when you are limited by lecturer. There is an alternative to get a student Turnitin plagiarism to check work (without storing your work in Turnitin database) so you can alter work to have a decent score before final submission. Visit StudentHub to get a Turnitin account that can permit you to do that. There are other plagiarism checkers web (though not as accurate as Turnitin) that can suffice the purpose of generating a plagiarism score such as Unicheck, Grammarly, PlagirasmCheckerX among others.

Turnitin is a paid service and typically acquired by universities on behalf of their students and faculty. If associated with a university, suggest checking to see if they offer access to Turnitin, or similar service, such as SafeAssign. For a quick check of your work for free, suggest Grammarly’s online plagiarism checker or paste a phrase as a Google search. Regardless of the tool used, none actually determine whether plagiarism exists, but rather, only similarity. Therefore, Turnitin is effective for determining originality, but for plagiarism, every portion of text written from an outside source needs to be cited. The failure to cite (or attribute) the original author is known as plagiarism and is considered an academic integrity violation and should be avoided.

Turnitin is not a free software. However, if your school or university is licensed to use Turnitin for checking students assignments, then your instructor may give you free access to check a paper. However, all the papers (including drafts) submitted to Turnitin are saved in academic libraries of a school. Thus, if you submit your paper to the system twice, the second one will be defined as 100% plagiarized paper. Right now we are using Unicheck at our school and it has the pre-check option without saving papers in the database of the school. It allows students to check their drafts before the final submission. You can check more on this topic here: Alisia Brin's answer to Can I check my submission for plagiarism before turning the paper to the instructor in Canvas LMS?

You should be able to get easy access to Turnitin plagiarism checker If your college has already subscribed to this service. Normally, your Tutor will have to give you a class ID so you can join his Turnitin class and submit assignments. Your tutor will decide whether he wants you to be able to generate and see the plagiarism report. In the case where you are unable to generate report but you badly want to know your plagiarism result prior to submission it doesn’t help when you are restricted by your tutor. There however, is an option to get a Turnitin account to check work prior to submission so you can edit to have a good plagiarism score. Visit StudentHub to get yourself a student Turnitin account that can allow you to do just that. Even better your work will not be saved in Turnitin’s database. There are other free plagiarism checkers online (most listed in other answers) but the fact is none come close to Turnitin in terms of accuracy.

If your college has subscribed to this service you should be able to get access easily to Turnitin. If your college doesn't provide or you're not a student luckily there's an option to get a Turnitin account with all its features (including E-rater grammar checker and no repository storage option) regardless at a fee. For more, visit StudentHub or their thread just to avoid all these other hassles of poking around trying to find loopholes that just end up being circular motion leading to exactly where you started. At least there you are guaranteed to get an original Turnitin account with full features. Fact check, No other plagiarism checker comes close to Turnitin's accuracy.

There are many accounts for sale on Quora and the Internet. However, why do you need it?... No, the question should be ‘What do you need it for?’ I would not recommend buying an unknown account and using it for checks of your academic papers. All the works submitted through the tool are saved in the general database. You won’t be able to submit the paper once again as it will be depicted as 100% plagiarised. The only way to check a paper and be safe is to ask your instructor for a free account. If your paper is submitted through the software as a draft copy, it will not be available in the general database.

The proper way is to ask your instructor, institution's administrator, or personal manager for access. Usually, higher educational establishments buy the number of licenses for students. They are granted to students for free to check academic papers during their studying. At least this is the case with Unicheck. However, I think Turnitin works according to the same scheme with minor alterations. Buying an account (either here on Quora, or on other portals) is another way to get access to the software. However, this option is not safe at all.

Check with your academic if you can submit DRAFT copies of coursework. This is the arrangement I use. That is, if a student submits early they can get a Turnitin report and amend the work. If you submit to Turnitin by any means you are adding it to their database, and it will be recognised as plagiarism when officially checked! This happens when students submit it via a friend, for example.

there is no such subscription. Turnitin doesn’t allow you as individual check at the university databases. But you can use other systems available at the market that allows you individual verification. there are plenty
Turnitin and Ithenticate Plagiarism checker available for sale.If you are interested contact me now. Thanks a lot. Please Visit my quora profile for contact details.
Scribrr appears to be a unique service but is actually just using the turnitin API Essentially scribrr is turnitin - it is not free or cheap however Scribbr - Your path to academic success

when you submit your paper, you should see a colored box with a percentage. They are color coded- green, yellow, orange and red. Click on the box and it should open the report which will show you all the matches highlighted in color.
